name: P. V. Skums
content: Skums Lab Computational Biology and Epidemiology Lab We are a research group in the Department of Computer Science Department at Georgia State University. Our research is focused on Computational Biology and Bioinformatics See details Epidemiology and evolution of highly mutable viruses Epidemiology and the evolution of highly mutable RNA viruses, such as the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and the hepatitis C virus (HCV). See details Computational Genomics and Next-Generation Sequencing Computational Genomics and Next-Generation Sequencing See details Cancer Genomics Analysis of tumor evolution using single-cell sequencing data See details Research Our research topics Learn more Publications Our publications Learn more CAREER Career Award Learn more People Our group Learn more Latest News 21 december 2021 Our paper "SOPHIE: viral outbreak investigation and transmission history reconstruction in a joint phylogenetic and network theory framework" has been accepted to RECOMB 2022 16 december 2021 Dr. Pavel Skums gave a keynote talk at ICCABS 2021 1 december 2021 Slava Tsyvina defended his PhD thesis. He is starting his new job as a research scientist at Facebook 1 june 2021 Slava Tsyvina received the MBD Outstanding Fellow award 1 june 2021 Pelin Icer defended her PhD thesis. She is starting her new job as a postdoc at ETH Zurich 15 april 2021 Dr. Pavel Skums received the Deanâs Early Career award 24 february 2021 Dr. Pavel Skums got the NSF CAREER Award
